## **Analyzing Nucleotide Sequence Data**

```{r, echo=FALSE, comment=''}
# Create a character vector of DNA sequences
dna_sequences <- c("ATGCGTACGTAGCTAGCGT",
                   "ATGCGTACGTAGTTAGCGT",
                   "ATGCGTACGTAGATAGCGT")

# Print DNA sequences
cat("DNA Sequences:", paste(dna_sequences, collapse = "  "), "\n")

# Calculate lengths of sequences
sequence_lengths <- nchar(dna_sequences)
cat("Length of each DNA sequence:", paste(sequence_lengths, collapse = " "), "\n")

# Count number of "A" in each sequence using base R
a_counts <- sapply(dna_sequences, function(x) nchar(gsub("[^A]", "", x)))
cat("Number of 'A' nucleotides in each sequence:", paste(a_counts, collapse = " "), "\n")

```

## **Monitoring Species Population in Different Habitats**

```{r, echo=FALSE, comment=''}
# Create a data frame for biodiversity data
biodiversity_data <- data.frame(
  Species = c("Oak", "Pine", "Maple",
              "Birch", "Spruce", "Cedar",
              "Ash", "Fir", "Beech"),
  Count = c(120, 85, 100,
            60, 150, 75,
            55, 95, 110),
  Habitat = c("Forest A", "Forest A", "Forest A",
              "Forest B", "Forest B", "Forest B",
              "Forest C", "Forest C", "Forest C")
)

# Calculate total number of species observed per habitat
total_species_per_habitat <- tapply(biodiversity_data$Count, biodiversity_data$Habitat, sum)

# Subset species with count less than 50
low_count_species <- subset(biodiversity_data, Count < 50)

# Print everything in one box
cat("Biodiversity data:\n")
print(biodiversity_data)

cat("Total number of species observed per habitat: ",
    paste(names(total_species_per_habitat), total_species_per_habitat, sep="=", collapse=", "), "\n")

cat("Species with count less than 50: ",
    if(nrow(low_count_species) == 0) "None" else paste(low_count_species$Species, collapse=", "), "\n")

```

## **Monitoring Temperature Changes**

```{r, echo=FALSE, comment=''}
# Create the temperature matrix
monthly_temps <- matrix(
  c(2.5, 3.1, 6.2, 10.5, 15.3, 20.1, 22.4, 21.9, 18.3, 13.8, 7.5, 3.9,
    2.7, 3.5, 6.8, 11.0, 16.0, 21.0, 23.1, 22.5, 19.0, 14.5, 8.0, 4.1),
  nrow = 12, ncol = 2, byrow = FALSE
)

# Name rows and columns (remove underscores)
rownames(monthly_temps) <- c("January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June",
                             "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
colnames(monthly_temps) <- c("Year 1", "Year 2")

# Calculate average temperature for each year
avg_temps <- colMeans(monthly_temps)

# Check if Year 2 had higher average temperature than Year 1
year2_higher <- avg_temps["Year 2"] > avg_temps["Year 1"]

# Subset summer months (June, July, August)
summer_months <- monthly_temps[c("June", "July", "August"), ]

# Print matrix
cat("Monthly Temperatures:\n")
print(monthly_temps)

# Print averages in one line
cat("Average temperatures per year: Year 1 =", round(avg_temps["Year 1"],1),
    ", Year 2 =", round(avg_temps["Year 2"],1), "\n")

# Print comparison in separate line
cat("Is Year 2 higher than Year 1 on average?   ", year2_higher, "\n")

# Print summer months
cat("Summer months (June-August) temperatures:\n")
print(summer_months)
```
